overview: This subject examines the use of financial statements for the analysis and valuation of companies. The framework employed incorporates four key components: (1) an analysis of the company’s operating environment and the strategies it employs; (2) an assessment of the quality of the company’s financial reports, including making any necessary adjustments; (3) forecasting future performance and cash flows; and (4) estimating a value for the company. Several valuation approaches are covered including the use of valuation multiples. And present value-based techniques.
